intro: Clianthus speciosus, commonly known as the New Zealand waratah, is a striking evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences composed of numerous pink to red flowers arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities through symbiotic relationships with root nodules. Its foliage consists of dark green, leathery leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. Clianthus speciosus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
